intro: Coccoloba densifrons, commonly known as the dense-fruited beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It produces bright red, fleshy berries that are attractive to birds. The species is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage and showy fruit.
